sources.title: Dependency injection in ASP.NET Core
key_points: Services should be registered in Program.cs using AddScoped/AddSingleton/AddTransient
Constructor injection is the preferred pattern
Service lifetimes: Scoped (per request), Singleton (app lifetime), Transient (each time)

sources.title: WPF Data Binding Overview
key_points: Target property must be a dependency property
INotifyPropertyChanged is essential for two-way binding
Binding has four components: target object, target property, binding source, path to value

sources.title: What's new in C# 12
key_points: Primary constructors for classes and structs

sources.title: Introduction to SignalR
key_points: Hubs are high-level pipeline for client-server communication
Supports WebSockets, Server-Sent Events, Long Polling

sources.title: Implement a DisposeAsync method
key_points: Use await using for async disposal
Implement both IDisposable and IAsyncDisposable when needed
Avoid blocking on async disposal in sync Dispose()

sources.title: Dependency Injection in .NET 8: Best Practices
key_points: Use keyed services for multiple implementations
Avoid captive dependencies (shorter lifetime captured by longer)
Register services by interface, not concrete type

sources.title: Use hubs in ASP.NET Core SignalR
key_points: Use strongly-typed hubs for type safety

key_findings: Modern C# 12 features like primary constructors and collection expressions should be adopted
IAsyncDisposable should be implemented for async resource cleanup
Dependency injection should follow service lifetime best practices
WPF MVVM should use INotifyPropertyChanged and avoid code-behind logic
SignalR hubs should be async and strongly-typed
gap_analysis: The xhMonitor project uses .NET 8 but may not fully leverage modern C# 12 features. Key areas to investigate: (1) Async disposal patterns for LibreHardwareMonitor resources, (2) Service lifetime management in DI container, (3) MVVM implementation quality in WPF Desktop, (4) SignalR hub design patterns, (5) Configuration management approach, (6) Use of modern C# syntax.
recommendations: Adopt C# 12 primary constructors where appropriate
Implement IAsyncDisposable for async cleanup operations
Review service lifetimes to avoid captive dependencies
Ensure WPF ViewModels properly implement INotifyPropertyChanged
Replace collection initializers with collection expressions
Avoid blocking async operations in sync contexts
